Welcome to the OpenCms documentation.

OpenCms is a powerful and highly customizable content management system providing compelling features, especially useful for large Internet and Intranet websites.

Text.name: Text0
Text.content:
If you are completely new to OpenCms, the following links provide a good starting point:

  • visit the source code repository of OpenCms, in the README, you get an overview of all features currently available
  • create an account on the OpenCms demo server and follow the tutorial where you will learn the basics of content editing
  • get an in-depth impression of what you can do with OpenCms beyond content edition by reading the OpenCms workplace chapter

Text.content:
If you are a web developer and, for the first time, want to realize a website project, it is recommended to start with the standard Mercury template instead of developing a template from scratch. To get started, follow these links:

  • have a look at the source code repository of the Mercury template, in the README, you get an impression of Mercury's features and how to customize Mercury's style sheets
  • install OpenCms with Mercury on your local PCâ€”the easiest way to do this is to use the official docker image
  • read the template tutorial which introduces into the basic concepts and methods of template development
  • install and experiment with the template examples
  • have a look at the template variants chapter of this documentation, describing how Mercury can be customized
  • the template development chapter of this documentation finally provides a full reference of all technical possibilities
